Class MutableShort

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
org.apache.commons.lang3.mutable.MutableShort
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<MutableShort>, Supplier<Number>, Mutable<Number>
public class MutableShort extends Number implements Comparable<MutableShort>, Mutable<Number>
A mutable short wrapper.

This class was created before the introduction of the the java.util.concurrent.atomic package and the AtomicInteger class.

Note that as MutableShort does not extend Short, it is not treated by String.format as a Short parameter.

Since:
2.1
See Also:
  • Short
  • AtomicInteger
  • Serialized Form

      public MutableShort(String value)
      Constructs a new MutableShort parsing the given string.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to parse, not null.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if the string cannot be parsed into a short, see Short.parseShort(String).
      Since:
      2.5

    • addAndGet

      public short addAndGet(Number operand)
      Increments this instance's value by operand; this method returns the value associated with the instance immediately after the addition operation. This method is not thread safe.
      Parameters:
      operand - the quantity to add, not null.
      Returns:
      the value associated with this instance after adding the operand.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if operand is null.
      Since:
      3.5

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Compares this object to the specified object. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a MutableShort object that contains the same short value as this object.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to compare with, null returns false.
      Returns:

    • getAndAdd

      public short getAndAdd(Number operand)
      Increments this instance's value by operand; this method returns the value associated with the instance immediately prior to the addition operation. This method is not thread safe.
      Parameters:
      operand - the quantity to add, not null.
      Returns:
      the value associated with this instance immediately before the operand was added.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if operand is null.
      Since:
      3.5
